intro: Osbeckia aubletiana, commonly known as the white sandflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Osbeckia aubletiana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
